page.title: 09Farming_ Fanville Farm\dairy
page.content: This is owned by the Shards and run with 2 other workers. It is an intensive dairy farm. They have l67 acres, mostly in grass. The cows take 2 hours to milk. They have a computerised hopper. The cows have special bleepers round their necks so they can only have a certain amount of food. They sell eggs, cream,and icecream to local restaurants and shops. They swop fields with other farmers instead of rotating their crops. Court Farm specialises in pigs and is owned by Mr. & Mrs. Slade. They have 223 acres, mainly in wheat and barley. The pigs are reared entirely inside. They have 9l adult pigs and about 36O piglets. All the pigs ready to be eaten go to Banbury market. In the past they have sent pigs to Poland and Taiwan.
